transition.label: OK[id]?
resBit = resBit^1, resSegIndex = (resBit==0) ? resSegIndex + 1 : resSegIndex, resCBIndex = (resBit==1) ? resCBIndex + 1 : resCBIndex
passed[nextCB]!
curSeg = nextSeg, nextSegIndex++, nextCB = boxes[nextSegIndex], nextSeg = segments[nextSegIndex]

template.name: CB

transition.label: i : t_id, j : seg_id, k : seg_id
lockedBy == -1
reqLock[id][i][j][k]?
result = lock(i,j,k), tid = i

query.formula: A[] forall(i:cB_id) not(CB(i).Switching) && CB(i).stem != -1 && CB(i).plus != -1 && CB(i).minus != -1 && CB(i).connected != -1 && points[i] != -1 imply (Point(points[i]).Plus && CB(i).connected == cBs[i][1]) || (Point(points[i]).Minus && CB(i).connected == cBs[i][2])
query.comment: The local state information about connected segments of a switch box is consistent with the actual state of the switch.

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) (TCC(i).DoubleSegment imply (CB(TCC(i).nextCB).connected == TCC(i).curSeg && CB(TCC(i).nextCB).stem == TCC(i).nextSeg) || (CB(TCC(i).nextCB).stem == TCC(i).curSeg && CB(TCC(i).nextCB).connected == TCC(i).nextSeg))
query.comment: A train can only cross a point if the point's position is consistent with the segment that the trains is entering.

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) (TCC(i).DoubleSegment imply points[TCC(i).nextCB] == -1 || Point(points[TCC(i).nextCB]).Plus || Point(points[TCC(i).nextCB]).Minus)

A[] forall(i:t_id) (not(TCC(i).Initial) imply (cBs[TCC(i).nextCB][0] == TCC(i).curSeg imply (cBs[TCC(i).nextCB][1] == TCC(i).nextSeg || cBs[TCC(i).nextCB][2] == TCC(i).nextSeg)) && (cBs[TCC(i).nextCB][0] == TCC(i).nextSeg imply (cBs[TCC(i).nextCB][1] == TCC(i).curSeg || cBs[TCC(i).nextCB][2] == TCC(i).curSeg)))
query.comment: A train's current segment is either the same as its next segment or connected to it.
All trains will eventually arrive at their destinations.

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) forall(j:t_id) i != j and not(TCC(i).Initial) and not(TCC(j).Initial) imply TCC(i).curSeg != TCC(j).curSeg
query.comment: Two trains are never on the same segment after the initialization step.
All trains must have a valid route composition. This means that the actual route must be greater than -1 and the padding must be -1.

query.formula: A[] forall(id:t_id) forall(i:cB_id) TCC(id).Initial or (TCC(id).boxes[i] == boxRoutes[id][i] and not(TCC(id).Initial))
query.comment: A trains internal notion of the control boxes will always be the same as its global counterpart after it has left the initial state

query.formula: A[] forall(id:t_id) forall(i:seg_id) TCC(id).Initial or (TCC(id).segments[i] == segRoutes[id][i] and not(TCC(id).Initial))
query.comment: A trains internal notion of its route will always be the same as its global counterpart after it has left the initial state
